text:
<@U011H02FR3Q>
Yes, so “basically asking how can I make my HubSpot website a PWA” this is my question.

I'm investigating building a Chatflow for one of our customers that would send data to an API endpoint they have configured to process information for an estimate/quote in real-time. I know I can do this via a custom code snippet in the Chatflow builder - which is great. However, the larger issue I am facing at the moment is that I need to notify the parent window at specific steps in that quote/estimate process to send off events to track conversions to things such as Google Analytics, and Facebook etc... - I cannot figure out how to do this - and its a major roadblock (we can't deploy something that cannot be measured). HubSpot only reporting/measurement is not an option - this data needs to be fed into the specific platforms. The custom code snippet is run server-side via Node 10.X so that won't work.

Is there a way to emit a custom client-side javascript event in a Chatflow?

I am not sure if this is the best location to place this question - so my apologies it if isn't (and please let me know where I should move it if this isn't the correct place).

Unfortunately I don’t see anything there that would allow me to subscribe to a custom event - all I see is conversation started.

I’ll need multiple events during the duration of a conversation (based off of the API responses happening behind the scenes and returned to the bot).
